results.title: Take three (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The work of three secondary teachers and their drama classes is observed to provide the basis for discussion of the approaches to drama shown, and the methods of evaluation in the subject. Shows students in the 11-12 years age group, 15-16 years age group, and fourth year students in an optional drama course.

results.title: Take the money and run
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and Palomar Pictures International
results.brief_description: Woody Allen stars, directs and co-authors this satire of all the prison dramas, chain gang eposes and true crime movies. It is basically a running gag about hero Virgil Starkwell, a master criminal who always bungles the crime (even one as simple as breaking into a gumball machine!), and ends up with more time in gaol than in his pursuit of crime. Full of Allen’s wry, dry wit this is one to delight the buffs and break the funny bone.

results.title: Tadpole and the whale
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Lord, Rock Demers and Les Productions La Fete
results.brief_description: The story of a special young girl named Daphne and her extraordinary relationship with the court jesters of the ocean. Nicknamed ‘Tadpole’ she is equally at home in the sparkling water as she is on land. Through her highly developed sense of hearing and her passionate nature, Tadpole builds a musical relationship with the humpback whales who share her second home. However, Tadpole’s happy world has dark clouds on the horizon, the most foreboding being the news that the inn where her parents work is about to be sold and they will be forced to leave. Worst of all, what will happen to Elvar, her best friend, who also happens to be a dolphin?

results.title: Take off at 18:00 hours
results.creator_credit: Santiago Alvarez and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: This documentary shows how socialist economic planning has helped to increase Cuba’s agricultural production. Focusing on underdevelopment and its possible solutions, it examines the mobilization of agricultural workers in Cuba’s Oriente province in April 1969. This was a trial run for the kind of mobilizations that were being planned for other parts of the country in the battle of increase agricultural production, and particularly the production of sugarcane.

results.title: Tackle happy (E)
results.brief_description: Tackle happy is a hilarious documentary about the comedy show “Puppetry of the Penis”. The film focuses on the stars of the show, ‘master puppetier’ Simon Morley and David ‘Friendy’ Friend and the trials and tribulations of running a production where they manipulate their genitalia for a paying audience. As the show goes on tour we see not only their tricks, but also troubles with the law, backstage tension, and the grind of travelling across Australia. Interspersed with dialogue from comedians Tony Martin and Mick Molloy, the documentary director, “Tackle happy” is a revealing look at the life of travelling performers and their controversial show. Anyone offended by male nudity would not find this documentary acceptable.

results.title: Take me out to the ball game
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: To keep themselves occupied during the off season, Wolves baseball players O’Brien and Ryan (Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra) moonlight as a song and dance team, much to the chagrin of more dedicated players on the team such as Goldberg (Jules Munshin). When training begins for the new season, they are surprised to learn that the new coach - K C Higgins, is keen to take a more active role in coaching. Fearing the worst, O’Brien and Ryan are pleasantly surprised to learn that the new coach is an attractive woman (Esther Williams) who knows her way around the baseball field. Friendly rivalry rears its head as the two friends both fall for the new coach, but eventually she must decide on one, and does so by choosing O’Brien. All is not lost for Ryan either, who finds himself in the arms of Shirley. O’Brien and Ryans love for vaudeville could be the undoing of the teams success however, as O’Brien is approached with a bribe by Gambler Joe Lorgan (Edward Arnold) to ditch baseball for the entertainment industry. Musical numbers staged by Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly. Cast also includes Betty Garrett, Edward Arnold and Jules Munshin.

results.title: Tabaran
results.creator_credit: Mark Gould, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, EMTV Papua Niugini, Kino Eye Pictures and Mark Gould Productions
results.brief_description: The Australian band Not Drowning Waving in 1988 went to Papua New Guinea to record sessions with Tabaran musicians. Their interest in the music was partly the attraction to the different instruments but also the new sounds created in a period of post-colonialism where western influences can be heard within rich sounds of traditional PNG music. The documentary traces Not Drowning Waving’s recording of the album Tabaran in PNG and the band’s involvement with local PNG communities. A rich cultural picture is the result as the band travels through a dynamic mix of different tribal cultures within the country, the colonial past, and contemporary street life.

results.title: Take heart
results.creator_credit: Penny Cordell, Women's Film Fund AFC and Film and Television Institute (W.A.)
results.brief_description: Western Australia nuclar disarmament protesters tell how they became active protesters against the United States nuclear ships using Coburn Sound. With the help of Dr Helen Caldicott the Nuclear Disarmement Party was formed in 1948 and they campaigned to have Senator Jo Valentine elected to the Australian Parliament. Shows how a small grassroots level group can succed in political ctivity.

results.title: Take a look
results.creator_credit: Milton van der Veen, Judy Haladay and TV Ontario
results.brief_description: This program enables children to discover the role science plays in their daily life. In each program, Jeffrey, a city kid spending his summer on a farm, explores one aspect of science with his friend Kate. She demonstrates a variety of fascinating experiments which children can do in the classroom. Curiosity and inventiveness are stimulated. The 20 ten minute episodes deal with plants, animals, astonomy, seasons, recycling, the weather, geology and basic physical principles.

results.title: Tabaluga. Volume 3
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Tabaluga GbmH
results.brief_description: A German-Australian co-production created by Peter Maffay, Gregor Rottschalk and Rolf Zuckowski, Tabaluga is the last surviving dragon on earth. Using a combination of fire and flight, both peaceful options, Tabaluga fights his nemesis the evil snowman Arktos, intent on ruining Tabaluga’s home of Greenland by covering it with snow and ice, thus making it inhospitable. Popular with adults and children alike, “Tabaluga” is in its third series and a feature film is in production. “The Wiser head does not give in” (story by Gregor Rottschalk): Arktos is firing snowballs at the volcano, covering it in a layer of white, rendering the volcano frozen and threatening to take over the rest of Greenland. Tabaluga is given an ultimatum, himself in exchange for the safety of the other occupants of Greenland. “Two birds with one stone” (story by Gregor Gottschalk, Heike Lage): A slumbering Tabaluga is carried by a group of soldier ants back to their Queen. She blames Tabaluga for the destruction of her Blue Army but soon comes to realise they have a common enemy in Arktos. “Moonstruck” (story by Gregor Rottschalk): Tabaluga vows to fly to the moon, even though no one else has successfully ever made it there. He seeks the assistance of Arktos and his powerful telescope to see it. Voices provided by Keith Scott, Robyn Moore, Jamie Oxenbould.
